intro: Xyridion stenogynum, commonly known as the narrow-mouthed flat-sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and swampy areas. Its flowers are usually pale green or brown, and it produces small, three-angled fruits. Xyridion stenogynum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of wetland habitats.
